metadata.title: CVE-2023-4569 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in nft_set_catchall_flush innet/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux Kernel. This issue may allow alocal attacker to cause double-deactivations of catchall elements, whichcan result in a memory leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5').
linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').

linux-oracle package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').

linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
